comment: If you want a professor who cares about you and your education, DO NOT take this class. There was zero effort put in from this professor. The class might as well have had no professor at all. She won't email you back and even if she does it will be a one word response. She will forget what she told you and punish you for it. DONT TAKE THIS CLASS

Most disorganized class I've ever taken. She will be unreachable over email and provide little clarification for assignments. Grades are never accurate or up to date. I just did her final and still have 0's for assignments I completed weeks ago before the due date. Take a different professor, seriously.

For the love of god don't take this teacher. She stopped showing up to teach during the weeks leading up to finals and doesn't teach the class but rambles. She doesn't provide any form of study material with extreme late grading and lack fo communicaiton.

I don't understand the negative reviews. Dr. Khan was truly understanding and wanted us to succeed. She provided clear instructions and grading criteria on how to secure a full mark. While due dates sometimes changed to what was listed on the syllabus, she would always inform us. She kindly extended two assignments for me as well! Take her for IS!

DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR 
When reading other reviews most were poor but the few that were positive changed my mind DON'T FALL FOR THEM. She canceled classes often, accused me of cheating when I didn't, and gave us an unfair group project for which half of my group didn't show up. HORRIBLE CLASS. PLEASE take another professor and focus on RATINGS.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Unorganized mess with communication issues, expects you to read her mind and makes up assignments at the last minute, and grades inaccurately.

No rubrics for any assignments and then you're graded harshly on items you didn't know where going to be assessed on. The exams are a joke, 25 questions to cover 5+ chapters and most of the questions are random pieces of information. She used discussion questions on the exam but locks the discussion thread after the due date.

If you didn't trust the other reviews on here then trust this one please. I didn't listen to the reviews and took Professor Khan's IS 2200 online. She doesn't care about her job. She just puts everything online for the whole semester and does nothing else. I never would've thought I would drop a class but this is a class I should've never taken.
I do not care what any of the good comments say. Please avoid her class at any cost, you will thank me later. I tried to give her a zero on here but rate my professors will not let me.

The worst professor I've ever had. Took her online IS2200 class and deeply regret it. The class is not super challenging but Professor Khan makes it way harder than it needs to be. She assigns these projects with the most unhelpful instructions possible and when you email her for clarification, she won't respond until after the due date. DON'T TAKE

She really helped me out this semester. Since the COVID situation, the final exam got moved up. I missed it because I was going off the syllabus for the final date. After emailing her, she agreed to open the final for me again so I can take it. She's really generous and caring. 10/10 would take again
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: I was nervous going into the class because of the other posts that I read. However, I had nothing to worry about. Mainly graded by projects, they each take a couple of hours but if you follow the instructions you will get a 100% on each one. If I missed a quiz I emailed her and she reopened it for me. Just ask her questions when you have them!

HORRIBLE NEVER TAKE HER! I have never in my life had trouble with an online class until this teacher. SUPER unorganized, i had no idea what was going on in the class and wasnt informed of any missing assignments until last minute! Save yourself and run!!

She isnt clear with instructions what so ever. When you email her about questions for the assignments she tells you to refer to the instructions... never helpful! However quizzes are easy! You need both of the books!!

Have not been in the class long but can tell that she is a terrible professor. She gave me points off for uploading something wrong for a biography to introduce myself to the class????? Included everything that was needed but obviously not. I would take her if it was your last choice which is what I obviously did.

She changes the syllabus EVERYDAY! Tests are 50 questions 50 minutes(yes open note/book but every IS Professor does that). Speaks in a monotone voice the whole lecture. Grades you more harshly if she doesnt like you. NO EXTRA CREDIT! She just doesnt need to be teaching. Pick her for last choice, if you desperately need the class.

Do not take this teacher. Her test bank is 250 questions and the lectures she gives does not reflect the test questions at all. She has a thick accent which makes it hard to pay attention and she should not be teaching business classes.

Professor Khan is a good professor. Her lecture is boring because she just read from the PowerPoint. As you expected, there are a lot of assignments to do for all IS2200 classes. But she would spend class time to help you do the assignments. She noticed who attended in the class. Chapter quizzes, Midterm and final exams. Online book is useful.
rating_tags: Respected--Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: TERRIBLE!!!!This class is an easy A if u already know how to use powerpoint & excel but her grading does not follow her own rubric or syllabus. Khan finds ways to knock points off so u don't get an A. DON'T bother emailing her BC she takes about a week, if not longer, to respond to your email. I wish I took this online like my friend who got an A.

Professor Khan knows what shes talking about, she just isn't good showing it. She drones through the power points, that all come straight from the book but are missing half the criteria so you're stuck reading the whole chapter anyway. Group projects are fine. Lectures are boring and monotonous, speaks too softly and goes too fast.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: Freeha Khan does not care about your performance and will give you a grade without even looking at a rubric. Do not expect a timely response on her emails as she does not care about student concerns. Multiple changes to the syllabus and exam days and formats. Avoid if possible...

Professor Khan's intro to information systems class has been horrendous. Her grading criteria is ridiculous; you'll do the assignment just as the instructions say, yet she will still find ways to mark off points and leave you with a C. There are two quizzes per week and an assignment due pretty much every week. The assignments feel like busy work.

Her grading criteria is not specific at all, you'll get a 50 on an assignement that you should have gotten an A on. A lot of busy work assignments that take forever to finish and she does not teach well. If you want a professor who reads word per word off a powerpoint and doesn't grade fairly, take her.

Super sweet and cares about your grades. Quizzes are in class, and exams scheduled for in class as well and you can use your textbook and notes. But she let us take our last two exams and quizzes at home. Group project is due in the middle of the semester and she finished our class a month and a half earlier.

Although class isn't mandatory, she does give quizzes in class (you'll know ahead of time via D2L) 1 big group project, but if you follow the criteria you'll get an A. tests and quizzes are online in class. She's caring and understanding. She's soft spoken.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Ms. Khan is very knowledgeable and brings her expertise to the class. Lots of assignments in this class, very demanding.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: She's a decent professor and nice lady, but the class itself is quite difficult. Especially in the last few weeks, there's a lot of readings and assignments. Not clear about assignment instructions. Group projects are difficult; pick your group members wisely. Two exams (midterm/final). You can still get a good grade if you put forth the effort
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Terrible teacher. Her teaching methods are by far the most unorganized, boring and not helpful. She tries too hard to get the class to discuss more with her about advantages of technology and what not but doesnt focus more on teaching the students what they NEED to learn. Her quizzes have a 12min limit.   SOME of the assignments are simple.

Unclear, unhelpful, uninterested. If you don't already know the material before taking the class don't expect to do well. The professor doesn't teach the material, tests on miniscule details from the book, and requires massive group projects to which she gives no instruction on how to do. I don't know if other professors are better, but avoid her.
Assignments due every week!! Nice professor.

Professor Khan expects that you know the basic knowledge of computer programming and brand names straight out of the gate.  Every testquiz is online and expect these scores to save your grade! Don't expect to get much out of the lecture but class attendance is mandatory and graded. Projects are long and difficult if you are new to information sys.

Weekly online quizzes, 2 online tests.  EASY. Gives attendance quizzes online also, just seeing if you're in class, you can do it at home honestly. Not clear at explaining assignments, particularly Excel & Web Resume. If you do them though, she pretty much gives everyone an 'A' for them, ask for help though.  4 easy discussion posts also.

She is a very nice teacher but her classes are very disorganized, and it is hard to hear or understand her despite her best efforts. She doesn't always clearly explain the assignments, and there are a lot of them. Tests and quizzes are really easy. Be ready for random, impromptu group assignments in class. I would not take her again.

There were a lot of little assignments throughout the semester. They weren't too hard, but some of them could've been easier to do and understand if she would've actually spent time teaching them. If you ask for help, most of the time you'll get it. Things could be disorganized but I think she's new here so hopefully she'll improve.

There are many assignments  and they seemed a little unorganized. I'm just guessing here, but I think this was her first time teaching this class specifically, so I'd be willing to bet things will be more organized in the future.

SUCH an understanding, helpful, and nice professor! Do your assignments and you will receive an A. If you need help, she will always help you (inside or out of class.) Lots of assignments but a lot of easy points to gain. I wish I could take her for every class. Love her!
Such a sweet and lenient professor. A lot of assignments, but only 2 tests the whole semester. Assignments are pretty easy. I definitely recommend taking her!
